Key Match Events: The Kings eventually pulled away for a convincing 127-104 win to give Phoenix their third loss on the year.
The Suns trailed by as much as 21.
The Kings shot an amazing 63% from the field in the first two quarters.
Pre-Game Insights: Down the likes of Kevin Durant, Bradley Beal and Grayson Allen due to injury, finding consistent scoring (on the second night of a back-to-back) was always going to be a challenge for the Suns.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Josh Okogie (25 points) led all Suns in scoring.
DeMar DeRozan was forced out of action early and did not return.
Others: The Suns got off to a poor start thanks to numerous turnovers.
The Suns missed their next 14 of 17 shots with Sacramento ultimately carrying a 93-80 lead into the fourth.
